section.title: I/O Monitoring (By Device)
section.para: This section describes how to monitor I/O activity on a specific device.
For some kernel versions (e.g. 2.6.21-1.3194.fc7, you may need to revise accordingly. SystemTap will output the following error if you need to do so:
If this is the case, revise by deleting the following lines in the script:

takes 2 arguments: the major and minor numbers of the device you wish to monitor. Its output includes the name of the process name, process ID, the function being probes (i.e. vfs_read or vfs_write), and the byte address being read from or written to.
section.remark: please verify if "0x800005" is "the byte address being read from or written to"
section.para: The following example is a snippet from the output of stap traceio2.stp 8 5, where 8 5 is the MAJOR:MINOR device number of /dev/sda5 (which we determined through cat /sys/block/sda/sda5/dev).

example.title: Sample Output
example.screen: [...] synergyc(3722) vfs_read 0x800005 synergyc(3722) vfs_read 0x800005 cupsd(2889) vfs_write 0x800005 cupsd(2889) vfs_write 0x800005 cupsd(2889) vfs_write 0x800005 [...]
